intro: Cladothamnus, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rutaceae. These shrubs are native to Australia and are characterized by their narrow, often hairy leaves and showy yellow or golden flowers. The flowers are typically clustered in dense spikes and are borne on slender pedicels. Cladothamnus species are adapted to a variety of soil types and can thrive in both coastal and inland regions. They play an important role in attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
